clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Cocoa Supplementation in Training Athletes Microbiota and Metabolome
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Cocoa Supplementation in Training Athletes Microbiota and Metabolome: Effects on Acute and Adaptive Exercise

brief_summary.textblock: It has recently been suggested that cocoa may improve exercise performance and recovery. This study aim to evaluate the plasma and fecal metabolome after 10 weeks of cocoa supplementation during the training period in recreational athletes to detect possible metabolites involved in the observed benefits of cocoa in athletes

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to 10 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.description: Abundance of bacterial taxa determined by 16SRNAr gene sequencing

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to 10 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.description: Abundance of fecal metabolites, metabolic networks, and metabolic pathways determined by High Pressure Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline to 10 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.description: Abundance of blood metabolites, metabolic networks, and metabolic pathways activity determined by High Pressure Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry

arm_group.description: 5 g/day of flavonoid-rich defatted cocoa for 10 weeks

intervention.description: Sachets of 5 grams of cocoa daily supplementation
Sachets of 5 grams of maltodextrin daily supplementation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-45 years of age
- high physical condition (VO2 ≥ 55 ml/kg/min)
- BMI 18-25 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- antibiotics intake during 3 months prior to the study,
- smoking
- nutritional complements
- ergogenic complements
- prebiotics
- probiotics
- vegetarian or vegan diet
- chronic medication
- gastrointestinal surgery
- Any diagnosed disease
